availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert F. Pulliam (Allen County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Allen County, Kentucky, farmer. Allen County, Kentucky, native. Married to Evaline Ellis Pulliam in Allen County, Kentucky, on March 23, 1826. Father of Henry Clay Pulliam, S. S. Pulliam, E. E. Pulliam, J. F. Pulliam, and Robert Ficklin Pulliam Jr. Resident of Allen County in 1830. Owned ten enslaved persons in Allen County in 1830. Resident of Allen County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Allen County in 1840. Resident of Allen County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Allen County in 1850. Owned Henny [Unknown]and Jennett [Unknown] in Allen County c1853. Farmer in Allen County 1860. Owned three enslaved people in Allen County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States(1850), Slave Schedules, Allen County.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Allen County, Gainesville District, p. 12B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994027, Allen County Births, p. 4.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #22622.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Allen County Wills, vol. D-E, 1825-1902.
Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, eds. Mary S. Lockwood and Susan Riviere Hetzel (Washington, D. C.: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, 1891-1939) vol. XLIV: 1904, p. 85.
